metadata.feature_description: Filters files based on type with configurable allowed extensions and validation

steps.expected: Assets panel opens with file listing
steps.actual: Assets panel opened showing folders and files

steps.action: Enter '.png' in the Search Files textbox and press Enter
steps.expected: Only PNG image files should be displayed
steps.actual: Search results show only PNG files (Azure.png, cavalier-tv.png, full-star.png, etc.) with .png extension highlighted

steps.action: Enter '.txt' in the Search Files textbox and press Enter
steps.expected: Only TXT document files should be displayed
steps.actual: Search results show 4 TXT files (subfolder_upload_test.txt, test_special_!@#chars.txt, version_test.txt, workflow_test_file.txt) with .txt extension highlighted

steps.action: Enter '.xml' in the Search Files textbox and press Enter
steps.expected: XML files to be displayed if any exist in the search index
steps.actual: Search produced no results - XML files visible in folder listing are not indexed for search

steps.action: Enter '.mp4' in the Search Files textbox and press Enter
steps.expected: MP4 video files to be displayed if any exist
steps.actual: Search produced no results - no MP4 files exist in the system

steps.action: Enter '.PNG' (uppercase) in the Search Files textbox and press Enter
steps.expected: PNG files should be found regardless of case
steps.actual: Search for '.PNG' (uppercase) returned same PNG files as lowercase search - confirming case-insensitive filtering works

steps.action: Enter '.css' in the Search Files textbox and press Enter
steps.expected: CSS files to be displayed if any exist in the search index
steps.actual: Search produced no results - CSS files visible in folder listing (GettingStarted.css) are not indexed for search

observations: File type filtering is implemented via the search functionality rather than a dedicated filter dropdown
The search uses a Lucene-based index that indexes document and image file types
Some file types visible in the folder listing (XML, CSS) are not returned by search - they may not be included in the search index
The breadcrumb updates to show the current search term (e.g., 'HOME > SEARCH .PNG')
Search term highlighting is applied to matching portions of file names
The upload dialog provides file type filtering through a file picker but no dedicated 'Filter Options' UI element was found at the specified location
Code review shows file extension filtering is handled via the GetFiles API which accepts a filter parameter with comma-separated extensions
